title: Riot, this is strictly about the site. This needs fixed before anything else.
body:
Part of the reason people aren't fond of this community beta is that the nested comments are hard to read. Seriously, its no wonder why.

[Click for Reference Image](http://i.imgur.com/S4J9yni.png) (The last bit of white on the right edge is my scroll bar, its very light, and fairly thin).

My monitor is 1280 pixels wide. This is a screen shot of the webpage for me. Since pixels are a little different for everyone, I'm going to talk about that screen shot in percentages.

Areas "D" and "E" are completely worthless. Nothing is stored in this space. Its where the pretty website's CSS ran out of pretty pictures to display. I understand it looks pretty, but the chat area is so small that these tiny areas are too much. Get rid of them, they take up 16% of the width of the screen.

Area "A" is atrocious. If the screen shot wasn't scrolled down so far you'd see the "sub-communities" section there. But the text in the sub-communities takes up way less than even its own box, and its box takes up less than Area "A" as a whole. Area "A" takes up 24% of the page.

So far we haven't even entered the conversation area and 40% of the page is gone. 40%!

Area "C" and "B" both serve the same purpose. They are to help visually represent the comment nesting so that it is somewhat easier to follow, but they're too big. While this is mostly conversation area up above, down here it becomes clear that it is WAY too thick. Both sides of the comment nesting could be cut in half in their width per nesting level and people would still understand. I wont bother saying the percentage that they take up because it will inevitably be different depending on how many nests down we are, but it is clearly a problem.

Then you have the area between area "B" and "C", this area is meant for conversation, and admittedly the text cant be touching the walls (that would look terrible) but because we're a few nests in the width that the text itself takes up amounts to only 35% of the page. 35%? That's ridiculous. It makes it impossible to read and that's not even the worst comment nest I've seen.

You need to adjust your proportions riot, the text area needs to be more prominent, and all of this decorative space needs to be thinned out. It may not fit with the rest of your site, but dear god we need some functionality here.

replies.body: We have an idea for space a that we're working on developing right now. The rest of the spaces are trickier but I'll definitely pass this on to the design folks
Thanks for your time and response Pendragon, sorry if my post came off as a bit bossy/mouthy.
You didn't at all. We always appreciate constructive feedback and suggestions.
I feel like "B" could be removed without loss of continuity. Just look at the left to see the nesting.
It actually looks super weird to do that because of the alternating box colors. we'll explore some stuff though.

True, but it can be shrunk by 50% or more and still look fine.  Also I really really hope the "an idea for space a" is get rid of it because some of us are reading this on laptops and a 4 inch comment column just isn't wide enough.  Looking at the "Rioter Comments" box that seems to float there now tho...  I'm guessing not so much.

Is there any chance you could add an option for smaller displays that gets rid of space A entirely?  Everything that lives there could be on the top of the page above the OP or collapsable.
So, pretty much a "mobile version" of the CB?

I'm not looking for something redesigned for a smartphone touchscreen.  Mobile versions of websites look terrible and don't work well on the desktop.  All I'm looking for is less wasted space.  4 inches for the comment column is too small but if we get the 3 inches back from space A then we'd have 7 inches with is fine.  It would be the same I get on GD which I currently prefer for the readability.

Remove boxes, remove double sided indenting, expand under community, make the entire thing a lot cleaner, and take this  http://www.reddit.com/r/AskReddit/comments/1y94xy/reddit_what_is_a_service_not_worth_paying_for/ as your inspiration, it's minimal, clean and actually useable, unlike r/leagueofledgends, or this.

I would really like more widgets. Like ALOT more, but have them optional to toggle on and off. Things like following other posters you like, a random thread button, even a site statistics would be pretty cool.

If you started making use of user specific settings, this could work out in a pretty cool way.

I respect the effort put in here and I do agree with area A effeciency and D, E lack of purpose. Personally I feel areas C and B are a "nature of the beast" thing for visually connected replies but I do agree that things can be improved in this aspect. Beta is Beta after all.

Of course, the Beta nature of the thing is why I feel like it might be worth my time to make this suggestion. B and C are honestly the least offending areas. Perhaps C (the left area,) doesn't need modification so much as B. C needs to be larger than B because of the way that we read, but B could almost not even exist, just the tiniest slivers would sufficient.

Area A should be removed completely.  Either move the sub community stuff to the top or just make the comments section expand to fill the whole area once you get blow the sub community stuff.  C and B might be "nature of the beast" but they could be better.  The indent on the left (C) needs to remain large enough to make conversations easy to track but on the right (B) it serves no real purpose.  The formatting would look weird if it were removed completely but it could be shrunk to just a few pixels, thus giving more room for text while still providing visual consistency with the left.

I'm more of a fan of expanding under the sub-comm list and other boxes that may later fill the right column. Usually OP's will go below there so I think that would work nicely.

As for C and B I think an easy thing to do would simply be to remove one of the two, allowing for the same differentiation between replies but expanding the post to one side.

I mostly agree with OP, there's just one thing I'd like to add:

The alternating colors on comment "depth" do help a little for figuring out which comment was a reply to what, but there is very little contrast and it's still frequently difficult to determine what a comment was in reply to.

You have good points here, and I agree with some of them. But just as a quick note - in threads with red posts, the Rioter Comment Tracker remains in area A as you scroll down, which I really like; I think it makes that a much better use of space!

Indeed it does. I still hold the opinion that it could stand to be much smaller though, especially since red threads make up a very small minority of posts, and the size of that area is a detriment to all posts, and benefits very few.

Good work actually explaining the problem. Nice to see some constructive discussion.

As others were saying, area A could be done away with entirely, or perhaps in part. B does really serve any purpose that C couldn't do. That 35% could be given entirely to C and I don't think we'd lose any sleep over it.

Probably what I would do, I would reduce B to aboud 90% of it's current width, leaving it there to still make the difference between psots but small enought to not clog up the page to much.

D and E i would keep but only for resolutions above X pixels.A cute I like to use is 1200px. Under 1200 I would think of either removing them entirely or cutting them in half.


Now for the A section. 2 options.

1. Have the sidebar toggle-able meaning I can chooose to show it or not and have that setting saved in a cookie or what ever system they are using to save my preferences.

2. Sticky sections. Not my personnal favorite but would at least fill in the blank.
i can't add bots on custom hexakill
